Hopefully this was just an isolated incident, but this morning I went to bed at about 2am, and woke up at 7am with my phone still charging at 70%.
It went up to about 70% from 4% in about 45-50 min, and then I can see from the chart it basically stood at 70-85% for the next 3-4 hours. 
I then unplugged and re-plugged and it started going back to normal speed, from 85 to 100 in about 10-15 min. 
After that, I was on my phone for about 15 min, and went back to sleep until just now - 11am. The phone was unplugged during this usage and for every minute after that. 
I checked again and GSAM did not register the 15 min on the phone at 7am at all. 
So I have 2 theories:
1) GSAM is somehow the culprit, because it's clearly not registering the data properly. Has anyone ever experienced anything like this?
2) I've been using the battery MOD and yesterday I took it off. For the past week it's been charging both the battery Mod and the phone at the same time. This is the first time it was just charging the phone alone. Maybe that caused some type of issue with the calibration?
Anyhow, I'll monitor tonight to see if it happens again...
I had the exact same problem last night. Have you found anything out or had it happen again? I also have GSam installed on my device.

replies.text:
It literally only happened that one time and then never again. Seems like it was a weird flukish thing. I wouldn't worry unless it happens again. 
The one thing I remember doing that night, which I haven't done since, is update all my apps in the app store, and then not turn my phone on again until morning. Usually when I do that, I'll check to make sure everything updated, and then clear the notifications, but this one time, I just left it. Obviously there's no way to know if that had anything to do with it, but either way so far it was a one time offense, so I basically stopped worrying about it.

thread.text: Well, it just happened again to me, but this time I was awake. It was charging and stopped at 78 percent and then just trickle charged just enough to hold it at 78 percent, just like it does when it reaches 100 percent. It's like it thought it was fully charged and went to trickle charge to hold it there. The plug was secure. So I then unplugged it and replaced it and it took off and started charging again. I don't get it.

title: Moto Z Force not fully charging over night

thread.text: Anyone else having charging issues? I plugged my Z into the stock motorola charger at bed time. When I awoke it was still plugged in but only at 70 percent charge? Any Ideas? Does charging stop during doze?
No it should be charging fully even if you have a battery mod on too. How old is your phone? You need to have it go in for warranty if it won't fully charge at all. Something is wrong it seems.

Well I mean it has charged fully every other time. It's only happened when I plugged it in and didn't touch it and left it sitting over night. When I woke up it had apparently stopped charging at 70 percent. I just found another thread here in this Moto Z Force forum titled "wierd charging issues" that describes the same thing, but he had a bit more detail.
Here it is. Check it out and let me know what you think. http://forums.androidcentral.com/mot...ing-issue.html

replies.text: Did you still see the little lighting bolt within the charge indicator that morning or do you recall? If you don't recall, it may have just lost connection at some point and it left it around 70 percent. Especially if it's charging normally now. I've had that happen to my Sony Xperia X where somehow the position of the phone just looses the connection while I'm thinking it's charging. Only happened a couple of times. Hopefully it was just that as that could happen to any of these phones. You also might want to check and see when or after you connect if your port and connection is not tight and wobbles. I believe that might be part of the issue on my Sony. Too much play between the connector and port therefore certain positions it separates for a moment until you move it and it links back together. Just some thoughts or things to check out.

thread.text:
Make sure the cable is seating fully. At first with my bumper case, I thought it was, but the case was in the way, and it would sometimes charge, sometimes not.

title: Moto Z / Z Force & Daydream VR

thread.text:
Anyone else been keeping an eye out for information on compatibility? Part of me wonders if Moto is waiting until they finish the Nougat (hopefully they'll jump to 7.1) upgrade to say whether or not the Moto Z / Z Force will be Daydream-ready (7.1 is one of the requirements for being daydream-ready). I've also wondered if they might do some kind of Daydream VR Mod made specifically for these phones. Though Google's daydream viewers look pretty comfy & well designed, and would be compatible with more phones. But perhaps a Daydream Mod would include a built in battery to allow for more play without worrying about running out of juice, or built in stereo speakers. (Though again, it might be better to just do the battery mod + Google's viewer.)
I'm just looking forward to some new fun toys.  I would be shocked if these phones didn't at least do pretty well with Daydream VR, considering their specs and how smoothly they run. Not sure if the Z Play will be able to handle it as well with the lesser processor though. Time will tell!
I'm getting the feeling that the Zs will get 7.0 as 7.1 will likely come to non-Pixel/non-Nexus phones in 2017, but we'll see.

I don't know of any leaked info that would indicate one over the other, so it's probably safer not to get hopes up, but a guy can still hope a little. lol

thread.text:
Having been on Samsung devices for so long and it being my only real day to day experience with Android, I've been learning a lot about what's really Android and what is TouchWiz. It's amazing to me how much Samsung has added to Android. Some of it convenient and positive and some not so much. I find myself trying something and it not working like I expected and then realizing it's because that particular feature was TW not Android. So far it's not really been an issue and I find an easy solution (play store) or workaround that does the same thing, just in a different way. 
I went back to the beginning of this Z Force board and was reading through some of the topics from the start and have changes the way I do some things because of the information here. One was a thread about the Google keyboard and the lack of a number row. Someone on that thread mentioned that Google now pops up a number row when it thinks you might need it, which kinda interested me to see how well it works. I always turn the long key press time down to at least 200 ms and thought, what if I turned it down to maybe 150 ms to use the top row for numbers when you just need one number here or there. Ends up working out very well for me and I'm finding that I'm much better on the Google keyboard than with Swiftkey which I've been using for a few years now.
I'm truly enjoying this phone and how fast and smooth Android really can be. I never really understood just how much of an affect TW had on my devices. I'd always read comments from others talking about their dislike for TW but never really understood why, now I see. 
Anyway, here's to trying something new and finding a better experience.

replies.text: Thanks for your thoughts! You can also use a the English US (PC) keyboard to have a persistent number row (although the keys get much smaller): How to add a dedicated number row to the Google Keyboard | Android Central

thread.text:
being a longtime Samsung user, the 2 things I miss the most when I switch to non-Sammy devices are the Keyboard and the Calendar.

I tried the Google keyboard just recently but had to go back to Swiftkey. I did learn a few things though and eliminated the number row. I made the long press time only 150 msec. Swiftkey also adds the number row when it thinks you will need it, depending on the field you are typing in.

replies.text: I've been a SwiftKey user for a couple of years until last spring. It started going wonky on me with strange word predictions and other odd errors. I switched to Google Keyboard and I like it better. I might try your mod to the default long press timing.

The Moto X received KitKat on Verizon before the Droid Maxx/Ultra/Mini (though the Droids were only a month behind on that one.) The Moto X has Lollipop, not the Droids. The Moto Maxx receive Lollipop before the Droid Turbo, and has Marshmallow in some places, while the Turbo does not. The Moto X Force received Marshmallow before the Droid Turbo 2.
In all cases except the Moto X the phones were on Verizon exclusively before they were available unlocked in the rest of the world (Turbo/Maxx, Turbo 2/X Force). There is also the Droid Maxx 2, which received Marshmallow long after the Moto X Play (though in this case, the X Play was available long before the Maxx 2.)
This is why I t think that the Droids will lag the unlocked versions (mostly because the unlocked do not require Verizon testing.) But, again - it could be different. So, again, I would expect it to be slower for the Droids and hope for it to be different. That's far less frustrating if you have to wait, and great if you don't.

I'm mostly attracted to the photo quality and the Google service integration. So as I'm looking around for a little more information, I came across the review from DxOMark on the Pixel and several other devices, including the Z Force. https://www.dxomark.com/mobiles/moto...-mobile-review
If you follow the link on a desktop you will see the ratings and a link to several other devices all the way down to a score of "50" for the IPhone 4. I was very surprised (pleasantly, I'll add) at a lot of the rankings. 
The fact that the Z Force scored an 87 is helping me get over the itch to try this new Pixel. Secondly, with Nougat coming for the Z I've pretty much talked myself out of giving this new device a try. Another big reason is the battery mod for the Z Force. I can have some very heavy use days and the ability to add the battery is a very big deal for me.
(Edit) Additionally I'd like to add that the first thing I do is add Nova Prime and set up all my apps, icons, & widgets the same as the device I'm moving from, very little about the experience would be much different. The Z Force has a very fast fingerprint scanner, a good display and its shatter proof. When I really look at the pros and cons I can't even come close to finding a compelling reason to change.

thread.text: Another question - since the SIM card is swapable, is it possible to have more than one of the same sim so instead of swapping you can just turn on one phone at a time to activate the card in that phone?

replies.text:
With the same Verizon account? No. Only one SIM can be active on a line at any time, and once you deactivate a SIM on your account, I am 99% certain it can no longer be reactivated.But, call VZW support to ask for sure.

thread.text:
Considering that the phone only game with a charger that has a cable built into the box, I'm exploring other charging options. My prior phone was micro-usb and I had fast charging cables and wall plugs and car plugs. I bought micro-usb to usb-c adapters, but now nothing is fast charging. I bought a traditional usb-c cable that I plugged into both my home wall charger and my car charger and neither are fast charging. Has anyone found anything to fast charge the Z other than the included charger?
Thanks.

replies.text:
It all depends on what you mean by fast charging. I have tested about 20 different chargers and cables. The ONLY was to get the turbo charging message to show up is to use a USB C to C cable. Does not mean it is actually charging fast. I have seen speeds from 5000 mah to 600 mah with the turbo charging message. The faster speeds coming from the supplied charger. Haven't found one as fast. They may be out there but I've got way too many turbo chargers as is. I think my wife would question my sanity if I bought any more chargers. 
I mainly usb A to C or C-C cables depending where I am at. The only way to get the battery mod to charge is using a C-C cable, at any speed. 
I hope this helps. I spent way too much time trying to figure this all out when I first got the phone. I was really frustrated and RY and a few others helped out alot. If you have any questions feel free to PM me and I will try to help, or post here. There's a lot of good people here willing to help.

thread.text: For "turbo" charging, you need a type c charger, with a c-to-c cable.

To get fast charging where the "turbo" moniker lights up you need to deliver more than 2.4A. I believe micro USB cables are limited to 2.4A, so anything bought to serve that cable output will not turbo charge. You can buy third party 3A chargers that use USB-C to -C cables. These will "turbo" charge. The brick that came with the phone can deliver a whopping 5A.

I got this charger a couple of days ago because I had the same issue - https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0172QQNBY...cUvbUpU5468868
I mainly wanted the turbo charging because it's the only wired charging method that charges my TUMI battery pack. This charger does that, and seems to charge rapidly, but I haven't measured it.
Here is mine, i feel like something is eating my battery life.
It would be good to post the app usage screen as that looks a little high. But maybe you're using apps that really suck battery.

FYI in case you don't know about the 'Restart Moto Mod' option in Settings.
I have the Tumi mod and it is configured in Efficiency Mode, meaning it keeps the phone's battery at 80%, rather than Default mode which keeps the phone's battery at 100%. This has always worked as described, until today. Today the behavior is Default, even though settings still says Efficiency. I changed the setting and then changed it back, but that didn't change the behavior. Mod SW version is 0.42 and check for updates didn't find anything newer. Then I saw the option Restart Moto Mod so I tried that - and it worked.

My Tumi battery mod starting doing they same thing last week. It always charges in default mode despite being set to Efficiency mode.
I have used Restart Moto Mod and it does not help.

It might have something to do with your permission settings. I messed around with mine and the same thing happened. Had to grant the moto mod app some deep level permissions and things went back to normal.
Uninstalling the Moto Mod app and reinstalling it seems to have fixed it.

replies.text: Not sure why, but my Moto Z Play (personal phone) runs much cooler than my Moto Z Force (work phone) despite identical usage patterns. Any ideas why?

Well the phones are pretty different. The Z play has a snapdragon 625 that powers a 1080p display while the force has an 820 that pushes a quad HD display. A more powerful processor pushing a higher res display is bound to generate some more heat.

thread.text:
Remember, a Lithium Ion battery has to be pretty warm in order to be fast charged. That would explain what you're feeling while it's charging.
Why one Z Force would get warmer than another during non-charging use? It's probably the difference in what you're doing with it.
If you think your Z Force is getting way, way too warm during playback only, I'd try a factory reset. That seems to solve about 90% of all the weird issues with any smartphone.
I don't play games, but the one time it got warm was when I was taking a lot of photos outside and it was a warm day. Even during charging it doesn't get as nearly as hot as my MXPE does.
Mine gets warm when charging or with heavy use. I wouldn't say it's excessive though. Just warm, not really hot.
Probably all that hot porn!

I have been on mine while Turbo charging for about 45 minutes. Playing games, surfing........ So far it's showing 92°F. I don't think that's too bad. I also have it in Otterbox Defender so I'm sure that traps a lot of heat.

Moto Z Force - BT works fine. I connect 24/7 to my Pebble and no issues. I connect to my car everyday and no issues. Car is for phone use only, no music - calls and texts.
Decided to get some BT headphones since I only have the one adapter and nobody seems to know where to get extras. Plus I thought BT would be nice when I am doing yard work or exercising to get the cord out of the way.
4 days ago I picked up some Aukey Loops from Amazon. Decent reviews from real users vs. all the free shills and I have had good luck with their cables and chargers. Charged them, paired them, sounded halfway decent! Much better than expected honestly after reading how bad some BT headphones can sound. Super comfy and stayed put so I was happy. 
Until... I tried to connect them a second time (or 3rd, 4th, 5th, etc). They connect instantly. I can receive calls and I can redial my last number easily. No music. All music comes through my phone speaker. If I check my connections it states "Connected (no media)". If I turn off BT on my phone and the headset and then pair again 8/10 times it will come back as normal "Connected" and music plays. That is the only way I can get it to come back and it is highly annoying!! I want to be able to just turn them on and go, not fuss with them every time. My Pebble and car do it flawlessly every single time. The only 100% sure way to do it is to tell my phone to forget the headphones and then repair them. Not doing that every time!
I checked all the boxes under settings in BT and the right boxes are marked off. I even turned off media and phone for my car settings to see if that helped based off a tip I read and that didnt work. I also dont want to have to turn those on and off every time if I want to use my car or my headphones.
Doing a search I saw a TON of complaints going back years with the same complaint from pretty much every manufacturer - Moto, Nexus, Samsung, LG, Sony, etc. What worries me is that I saw NO fix! This is going back to 5.0 through 7.0. I have to hope there is a fix out there with everyone getting BT headphones lately.
Oh - forgot - I tried my friends Jaybirds just to see if they worked. Nope. Work 100% the first time. Worked maybe 2/10 tries just turning them off and back on. 8/10 cycling BT off and on. Pretty much spot on with the Aukey's.
See what happens if you turn off the Pebble and then connect. I'm wondering if the Pebble is somehow preventing media connection?

Turning off Pebble did nothing. Only way to reliably get it to connect is to re-pair every time which is a giant pain. I am sending these back and not sure if I will try another brand since the Jaybirds were doing the same thing.
I also spoke to Moto this morning about a USB adapter. They are not offered for sale but she said a lot of people have been asking. You think?! Why would you make the phone, make the required adapter and then not sell the adapter? I asked what happens if we lost one or it breaks and she said they can ship a new one out on a case by case basis. I think it's beyond stupid on their part to offer things like style shell Mods and not offer a freaking required adapter!!

replies.text:
Yep! 
It'd be interesting to see if these work though: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01KJNN2PW...cUvbUpU5454419

I figure they will eventually come out with decent adapters if more phones move away from a 3.5mm jack but I cant wrap my head around the fact that Lenovo refuses to sell adapters for their phone. I have a favorite set of headphones for home and work and I would like to just keep the adapter attached.

I wouldn't assume that they "refuse" to sell them. They still can't keep their style shells in stock. Last I checked the shattershield replacements weren't available yet. I think they'll be available eventually, but they didn't have the supply chain ready for selling them as accessories in addition to supplying the device production yet.

thread.text: I have the leather style back ordered and is has and est delivery date of Monday the 26th. Ordered on Friday the 16th. I noticed today all the backs on Motorola's web site are out of stock. Status on my order is at the "device being built" step, been there since the 16th.

After ordering the leather back I decided I needed to modify the original "wood" back that came with my phone. After seeing how Dconn1975 wrapped his battery mod (turned out very nice), I decided to come up with a few options for the original wood back. Having zero experience with 3m wrap I decided that would not be a good option for me and if the paint doesn't work out its going in the trash anyway. So I found some bedliner paint I had left over from another project and decided to give it a try. It probably took all of 15/20 minutes for prep time and about 30 seconds to paint. Now I'm just waiting for it to dry completely so I can install. Here are a few photos of the outcome so far.

replies.text: Looks very "grippy"

I hope so. I'm being very patient right now and letting is dry completely. Maybe even a little over kill. My biggest concern is it will scratch or peel easily. I scuffed it up with a fairly rough sandpaper (I figured I could get away with due to the amount of texture in the paint) cleaned it good with alcohol and then painted. I'll post photos of it on the phone in a bit.

So I'm half way through the day and this is definitely "grippy", matter of fact it's probably closer to "tacky". It's not picking up lint or anything but if I'd tried this before I ordered the leather back, I might not have ordered it.
Very cool! I did my whole truck in bedline, and only part that is wearing is the bed where I've drug stuff and scratched it off. I think youll be happy with it.

Great now I have to go to the auto parts store and pick up a can of bed spray. See what you did. Thanks. Haha.
I have the leather back from Moto on my phone now. But I do switch and put the wood back on if I'm working or doing something where I don't want to mess up the leather. I really don't like the wood so this will be a perfect fox for me!
Thanks!

This is exactly what I was thinking. I'll use the leather on normal days and then use this for times I don't want to mess up the leather. 
You'll love the grip, it will feel a little tacky most of the time. I really like it.

Don't do it. It ends up that after two days the bed liner paint started "melting" or "pushing" into thick lines of paint in the areas where I hold the phone the most (heavy wear areas). It went from tacky to down right sticky. So I took a coarse grit sanding block to it and removed all the paint. Then a fine grit to smooth it back out. Turns out the thing is actually wood. Very thin wood laminate, but wood just the same. It now has what my crafty wife would call a little bit of a "distressed" look to it. Not really an issue and my leather back is in the hands of FedEx. It should be at my door on Wednesday the 28th.
You get my vote for the "Coolest Solution to a ZForce Situation" - a phone with a bed liner - or - a bed liner that makes phone calls.

thread.text: I'm not brand loyal at all and had a phone from all major players...and I've been around since the "Bag Phone" from the 1980's. If it weren't for the Battery issues of the Note 7 (and studdering lag) it might be a harder call. The Z Force wins on so many fronts though, especially because of the Mods. Looking to the future, new Mods will add freshness, functionality and value to my device, whereas with the Note 7, I could update the case and replace the cracked screen protector(zzzz)...My wife and I both have the Z Force and can swap Mods which comes in handy for Gift ideas...I buy her a new Mod and if I ask nicely, I can use it to, Lol!

If the exploding batteries hadn't happened I would have a Note 7 right now. I'm not 'happy' that Samsung has these problems, but very happy that I ended up with the Moto Z force. This is only my third cell phone/smart phone in my 67 years, and all have been Motorola. So I'm pretty familiar with their product, and this is a great phone so far. 
I went for the deal of buy two mods when you initially purchase the phone, and I bought the battery and JBL speaker mods. The turbo battery charger is so good, and the battery life on the Z is so long lasting, that I took both mods back for a refund, and will use the $ to get a stand alone bluetooth speaker.
I had the Note 7 and returned it due to the battery issue. Got this Z Force as an interim device until the re-release of the Note. Decide after two days with the Z Force I would not be going back.

replies.text: If it had an led notifications light or ir blaster I'd be in.

thread.text: Tried really hard to get rid of this device and go for the note 7 and just couldnt. Screen may be a tad better and camera may focus quicker but the Z force is THE perfect phone. Its beyond quick and easily outperforms the note 7 in every regard. Bloat free and lag free, cant say the same about the Note 7, battery is beyond amazing, get 6+ hours SOT and so is standby time. Clean stock android ui looks a lot better than grace ux too, i had an S7E and i remember i got sick of the phone from touchwiz even though it was an amazing all arounder. The Z force by far even trying a nexus 6P for 10 months which i loved still doesnt perform as the Z force does

Ditto! I'm super impressed with the Z Force, not brand loyal at all...as a matter of fact, this is my first Motorola phone and I'm Gaga (not Lady Gaga, she probably has a Note 7) with it...I do have to say Bad Romance sounds pretty good with the speaker mod tho, Lol!

This is my first Droid also, and i'm very impressed. I did have the Note 4, but found that i didn't use the stylus(S-Pen), as much as i thought i would. The Note 7 would be great for me, however, i'm not a spy or in the demolition business.LOL
Any difference in LTE reception between force and sammy products?

replies.text: Better reception than on my Note 4.😛

thread.text: That's good to know. My RAZR maxx hd was great but it was a moto moto. I didn't know if the new moto had moto quality radio software. It always was the best

I returned my force actually, which i regret. I returned it due to it always being warm when in use 24/7. It was always in the 97-105 degree F temperature which, didnt feel hot but could potentially harm battery life as my S7E i have right now runs extremely cool. I had an S7E before too, and they both run the same, always 10-15 degrees cooler than the force. But damn i miss the force a lot, especially the stock ui. Battery is a tad better on the edge though, about an hour extra of screen on time. Hmm i can still return this edge and go back to my force, not sure both phones are beyond amazing
I haven't seen many posts about the Force running warm consistently. Maybe you got a bum one or some app isn't playing nicely with Moto's UI?
Maybe. But it ran hotter than my S7E. I eill be taking my edge back agin lol for another force and i will keep the force this time lol. Loved the force
The Force will be with you, always.😉
Which has the better display?

replies.text: If you look at a previous post, the poster said the Note 7 screen may be a tad better, which is pretty darn good for the Force as Samsung screens are generally considered the best cell phone screens.

thread.text:
Hey all, 
I'm currently on my 2nd Note7 and have been struggling with battery life, so I'm thinking of jumping to a different phone. The Z and Z Force are both really interesting to me, but I'm concerned about the Mods.
There are a couple that are useful (battery and speaker), but the rest are gimmicky. I go back all the way to the Moto Atrix and its "Lapdock" which was a cool idea but not as good IMHO as the idea was.
I'd love to see a dedicated DAC w/hp jack for the Z, but I haven't been able to find any info or leaks on any new Mods coming out. Anyone have a scoop?
Thoughts? I like a lot about the Note7, but battery anxiety is really killing me.
Thanks!

replies.text: My husband loves his battery and speaker mods. He tells me every day how great his battery is ... I think comparing it to my Note 7, which will get me through a day if I chose to not charge at all throughout the day. He might have a better battery but I have the better screen. Just my opinion.

I rocked the Lapdock with my DROID Bionic. Ahead of it's time. 
Moto might be ahead again with Moto Mods.

thread.text:
Hopefully they eventually finish & release the OneCompute mod.Motorola's OneCompute uses a Moto Mod and a dock to turn the Moto Z into a desktop computer
Also, hopefully the aftermarket picks up on this. I think now that the Z Play is out, and the unlocked versions are coming out, that accessory makers will see the devices are popular, and create for the platform.
Very cool!
Powerful hi-fi DAC mod with FM radio.... no rocket science, wonder when someone has the idea to build one
Just returned my replacement note 7 and opted for the z force. Just getting to know it. I like it so far.

replies.text:
Welcome to the dark side. I did the same thing with the first round of Note 7 battery issues and never went back. The Z Force is an awesome device.
I did have a little trouble sorting out some of the features that I thought were Android but ended up actually being Samsung TW. Nothing was an issue though, more of learning a different way to do the same thing. Anyway, enjoy your new device and ask away if you have questions, I've found the Z Force group to be very informed and helpful.

thread.text: I'm looking at the Z Force to replace my Note 7. Any Moto owners having regrets about the lack of headphone jack? I use my phone semi-regularly for conference calls and I'm concerned about always having to have a bluetooth headset charged and ready.

replies.text: It comes with an adapter so if you're only an occasional headphone user, I'd say not an issue. I use an LG Tone+ Bluetooth headset everyday at work, so not an issue for me. Also connects to my truck as I get in and start it up. Smart lock works great with Bluetooth devices Btw.
No regrets at all.

thread.text: You can also use the dongle adapter with regular headphones, but you cannot simultaneously charge fwiw.

After the last security update, Bluetooth won't even turn on now. I continue to click it, the slider moves to the right (still stays Greyed out) and then slides automatically back to the left. I've rebooted the phone and tried again over and over and it won't work.
Is anyone else having an issue with this?
Try wiping the cache partition: https://motorola-global-portal.custh...il/a_id/112125
Did that and wiped the phone cashe as well. Still not working
I'm guessing it's an app issue. Because I ask everyone with weird problems this question, do you have the app Gas Buddy installed by any chance?

No I don't have gas buddy. I've actually deleted any apps that I may have downloaded before the issue started and it's still not working. I really don't want to do a Factory Reset but it's looking more and more like I might have to.

I had this exact same issue, as have at least one other person on the Moto/Lenovo forum. The BT radio refuses to turn on, in safe mode, after wiping the cache partition, or after a complete factory reset. Happened immediately after the September udpate. I suspect an update software issue. I received a replacement phone from Verizon, installed all of my previous apps from backup and then successfully applied both the July and September updates. Since this has not happened to everyone, it may be connected to some custom issue. On my previous phone, I renamed my device name on Bluetooth. I did not do that for my replacement. It is possible that changing the BT device string caused the update to bork. It's a hypothesis anyway. Anyone experiencing this problem rename their device?

Well this morning as soon as I took it off of charge it started going into an infinite reboot cycle. I was able to stop it. Then it wouldn't connect to WiFi. I did a factory reset and it wouldn't even activate after the reset. Took it to Verizon and I'm getting a new one tomorrow.

replies.text: Well at least you know it was a complete hardware FUBAR. Verizon replaced my phone via overnight shipment. Reinstalling from backup was a snap.

thread.text: Yes, people are having an issue and no for most people it did not help. Moto knows about it, but they need to push an update to fix it.

Still debating whether i should return my Z force, it runs a tad bit hot 94-105 F when using it for browsing as an example. Also want to know people SOT on average. I get about 5 hours sot but that seems low as i have nearly every feature off/ radio/ gesture, my S7E got 7+ for me

I presume you want to know SOT to determine how long the battery will last on one charge. Here's my go-to resource for this information. It's a standard, repeatable test done by the same people so comparing across devices should be valid.Battery life tests - GSMArena.com
It does show the Z Force as having a very slightly better battery than the S7E (U.S. Model).

thread.text: ^ I think you're quite the overachiever there. Unless one compares identical setups and usage it will be all over the place. But fwiw, about 24 and 6 hours SOT with not a very strong signal.

I turn airplabe mode and wifi calling on when im at home so cell service isnt a problem i still receive texts and calls on airplane mode with wifi calling

thread.text: Could be the apps you're using. Social media is a big drain. I get about 5 hours SOT on average which is more than enough for my preferences. Even spending that much time looking at my phone on a given day is a little disheartening.

thread.text: Get GSAM battery monitor and then post some battery stats. There may be a reasonable fix or sometimes a particular phone doesn't do as well with a person's usage patterns.

I'm researching the possibility of getting a new phone. The Note7, Z Force Droid, and Play Z are on my radar. Battery life is of paramount concern for me. I have to chuckle when I go to the Note7 forum and read people's glowing reviews of getting 4 hours SOT and still have 15% battery remaining! They think this is battery awesomeness. If they only knew...

replies.text: Lmao, 4 hours is average. I get about 6.5 hours when the battery hits zero but im still returning mine as im pretty sure mine still may be defective as mine runs a bit hot and i see people with better battery life while all my features are off

thread.text: My S7E and moto Z force ran down to 20 percent with same usage patterns.
Z force
I noticed that the S7e was using less power for more screen time. Perhaps it's more efficient or brightness was different. Battery life is always a slippery slope to navigate.

replies.text: Ill try out Gsam but that was my SOT with very similar set up to my S7E. I am not sure how the other person is able to achieve 7 hours of screen time with 41 hours of total time, my Z force was about to only get that in less than 24 hrs

What do you do on your phone for the majority of your SOT? I'm just curious because those #'s are stupendous. Are you mostly playing games, web browsing, texting, watching videos /movies? 
I get about 5 hours SOT on the Force without the Battery MOD, but I have 4 emails auto pushing and a bunch of other apps that are syncing as well. I text a fair amount, and on WhatsApp a lot, have games like Clash of Clans in the background that I might jump onto very sparsely if I get a second. I have yahoo news syncing and other sports feeds also giving me notifications regularly as well. I also talk on the phone for work at least 2 hours plus a day, sometimes more. 
With all that I can't really come close to 7 hours, and certainly not over the course of 2 days, at least not without the battery Mod. 
I'm currently using the battery MOD everyday anyway, so I easily get through the day without even the slightest concern, no matter how much I put my phone though. 
But I'm just curious, because I know without the MOD I wasn't getting close to what you're getting on your Edge. Separately, on a side note, I work everyday with a colleague who uses an S7 Edge and has his phone running pretty similar to mine. He's usually looking for a charger at the end of the day whereas I'm never even close, and wasn't ever close before using the battery MOD everyday. 
I know usage habits are the biggest factor in battery life for any user, so I'd love to hear what you're using your phone for predominantly in order to achieve such great #'s in terms of SOT.

title: Bluetooth Earbud for the Moto Z Force ?

thread.text:
I need an earbud type bluetooth for my Moto Z Force phone. I had a Motorola Command One paired with my old Droid Razr, and the Razr MaxxHD. Lost it and never replaced it. I am retired and don't need it for work, but I like to talk on the phone hands free. So I looked around the web, around town, and cannot find Motorola earbuds in brick and mortar stores in my locale. 
Make a long story short, I wanted it now, so I went to the VZW store and bought a Plantronics Legend. Sound was great for me, and for the caller, fit my ear nicely, buttons worked ....... but it repeatedly dropped calls. So I brought it back and got a refund.
I've been looking (online) at the Motorola HX550, or H730. I liked the way the old command one (motorola) was designed, and wondering if anyone has any experience with these, or could suggest something that worked for them ?

Moto just released a pair of earbuds. I think they are called the Verb. I want some. They are pricey but they are not hook together so you can use one only if you rather. I read an article on them the other night.

Thanks, I found those, as well as a new single bud called Motorola Hint. I checked amazon and the hint got better reviews than the verve, neither got 5 stars. I think I may go with a Planotroics Legend 5200. I haven't made my mind up yet.

I <3 my plantronics 5200. I'm on the phone 4-6 hours a day, works fantastic. Its an improvement over the Legend or Edge (I used both for months as well).
For music I use the jaybird X2. Works fine for calls too.

replies.text: Does the 5200 have a plug in charger to the earbud ? I notice a lot of complaints from people who say the magnetic charger of the Voyager/Legend series is inconsistent. I looked at the Jaybird but I don't want the X2 feature in a bluetooth headset.
It takes a micro usb right into the base of the earpiece. If you buy the travel charger/desk stand that charges via magnetic connection like the legend does.

thread.text:
I like my Jaybird X2. It took a while getting the right fit first time but all is good now. Great for music.
I also have a Plantronics M70 which is light on the ear, can stream audio and has a 11 hour battery life.
I just bought the power beats 2 wireless ones at Verizon. Love them.

I thought the phone is a little slippery, so I bought the bumper case from Verizon and like it. I also added a glass screen protector because have read that the other shatter proof screen scratched easy. So just figured I would be safe.
Phone still looks pretty much naked.

I'm using the style mod that came with the phone but nothing else. I do have a case for times I need extreme protection but don't use it much. My only concern going totally naked is that the mod connectors on the back might somehow get damaged constantly putting in and out of my pocket and setting down in the car. Its probably not a warranted concern, but one I have anyway. With that said, the phone feels great to handle with just the style mod.

Sides, the finger print reader, the back, and the area that covers the flash. The glass front wasn't too bad and the camera cover wasn't bad. But this guy goes to the extreme with it too. Check it out on YouTube.

thread.text: As long as the screen is usable I dont care about the rest of it. Shatterproof is a huge bonus there and I don't put my phone in my pocket with keys or rocks so scratching the screen isn't a huge concern. Also as long as the camera is ok.

Is anyone using the stock messaging & email apps? I've got two questions. 1- Can the email app be set to delete emails from the server? 2- Is messaging+ better than messaging, and if so, how? Thanks for any help.

replies.text:
I can't speak on anything about the email cus I use the official apps for Gmail and Outlook. 
I personally like messages+ because it's so customizable and I can check my text messages from my laptop as well. Others will have their own opinion but for me messages+ works.

I use the stock app for my exchange account. I did not alter any of the settings. When I delete a message on my phone, it is deleted on the server. For my personal account, I use the Gmail Inbox app. I agree with the others that the Messaging+ app is good. Some don't like it specifically because it is "Verizon bloatware". However, I found it to be a good alternative. I'm waiting to see what Google Allo will offer and may potentially switch to that when released.
I'm gonna give Google Allo a try as well! It's gonna have to be totally awesome for me to make the switch lol
i've been using the stock email app for my gmail & hotmail accounts. When i delete emails from the phone, they are NOT deleted on the server. It must be a setting on my Mac.

thread.text: Messages+ is really good, but I enjoy Textra.

Messages+ is surprisingly good. Very customizeable, able to be used on my laptop, iPad AND iPhone as well, plus works over wifi. It's replaced Textra as my messaging app of choice. For e-mail, I use the Gmail app.
I have the same issue but on my PC so I don;t think its a Mac issue.

replies.text: It doesn't happen when I use a better email app, like TypeMail or BlueMail.☺

thread.text:
Whether the email is deleted from the mail server or not is not a function of the app other than to maybe allow or not. It is based on the type of mail account you are using. POP3 mail accounts will not allow for a mail client to delete mail from the server where IMAP accounts will allow this but I've not seem them work very well or at least not very fast. Exchange accounts or made for this. Most will keep your mail, contacts, calendar and task all in sync. I've found Nine to be one of the best exchange clients by far. 
Verizon Messages+ is very customizable and works well.
Nine doesn't allow gmail, but i've found AquaMail, which does allow gmail & hotmail. When i delete mail on the phone, it deletes the email from the server.

Gmail app if setup for IMAP will delete emails off the server. My only issue with Gmail is it can be a bit slow for my work account. title: Got An Old Fashioned Film/Plastic Screen Protector

thread.text:
I bought my Moto Z Force over at my local VZW store about 10 days ago. Upgrading from my Razr MaxxHD. Love the device. So at the store I told the salesman that I wanted a screen protector, and he went to the display and picked one out. 
He was taking it out of the package to install and I said, "How much is it ?" $34.00 he replied. I asked how many you get and he said one, but it is guaranteed for life says he. Why is it so expensive ? Because it is tempered glass. 
Well, the idea of paying $34.00 to put a piece of glass over the glass that is guaranteed against breaking for 4 years didn't make much sense to me. Plus it would add thickness to the device, so I said I don't want it. Do you have the old plastic ? Nope, VZW doesn't carry those anymore.
Cutting to the chase, checking out Amazon and ebay, I found a Fosman Screen Protector for a few bucks, 3 in a pack, and free shipping. Received it just yesterday and it is a perfect fit, wasn't too difficult to install, and looks great on the phone. IOW, you don't even know it is there. If there is anyone out there reading this, who isn't happy with the 'progress' made in screen protector technology, this product fills the bill.

VZ sells a three pack for like $12.
He told you no for commission sake.

Remember, plastic protectors only protect against scratching. Tempered glass only protects against shattering. (Gorilla glass shatters when hit, tempered glass crumbles.) There's nothing that protects against both scratching and breaking except transparent steel - and that hasn't been invented yet. (We'll probably see artificial diamond protectors first.) I'm still on my first plastic protector after 4 years (and an Otterbox).

replies.text: Technically since the Z Force has the shatter shield all you really need is a plastic screen protector to protect from scratches. Because the shatter shield will scratch! I choose to use a glass screen protector on my force for two reasons, first to protect it from scratches and second because I like the feel of the glass.

Coming from the Note 7 and the horror stories about the slightest of drops cracking the screen, I find great comfort in have the ShatterShield. I put the Verizon flexible glass protector on to keep it from scratching and the black bumper to prevent frame damage. 
I definitely don't treat it like it's indestructible, but I also don't sweat the two foot drops it takes from time to time off the arm of my chair. Sometimes it's the small things that make me happy.

The shattershield is the best thing I have seen out there. No worries about dropping the phone. Love that part about Moto Z force. From what reviews I have seen Note 7 does take up a few drops before completely shattering. But nothing can compare to Moto Z force.

Yes, the Note 7 has the potential to shatter because it is glass front and back with a curved screen. The Z Force's glass screen is protected by plastic, so they are two very differently designed phones.

title: Moto Battery Mod and Turbo Charger

thread.text:
Hi, I got the Moto Z Force recently and I really like it. I had a Droid 2 global followed by a Moto X (2nd gen). I find it hard to leave the moto stuff behind so I'm glad this phone feels familiar. 
I was curious about the Moto Battery Mod. I would like to get one (I've seen Tumi mostly) but wanted to ask if it was meant to be on the phone at all times? I'm not sure if there would be any detrimental effects to leaving it on all the time. 
I'm also wary of the turbo charger, I'm using it for now but I've always heard that quick charge stuff lowers the lifespan of your battery due to heat and all that. If anyone has any insight for me on any of this I would appreciate it, I think I may just be too cautious but wanted to be sure before I dropped some money on a mod or a new charger.

I am just as cautious as you are, but either way you'll be fine. The turbo charger is the one that comes with the phone so I can't imagine the manufacturer putting out something that is detrimental to their own product.
As far as the battery mod is concerned, if the Force battery wasn't so good I would use it all the time. I first had the regular Z and was using the mod 24/7. It worked great, but even with that thin phone felt a tad heavy. With the Force it would definitely be a little heavy for me for use all the time. But it sure is nice to have around for when you might need it.
When I first shopped the Z phones the Moto rep was in the Verizon store. He said the battery mod on the phone 24/7 was absolutely fine.
Yeah, the battery mod should be fine for constant or occasional use. Pretty sweet like that...

I've done research on this and leaving the battery mod on would probably actually help prolong the internal battery life. Batteries last longer when they have more incremental charges than a few long charges. The biggest killer to battery longevity is heat. By charging in shorter bursts, the battery doesn't heat up as much.
Having the battery mod on and set to 80% will effectively trickle charge your phone...keeping the heat level down.

How does the battery mod work ? Charging on a wireless charger does the mod charge first then charge the phone? is there a on off switch or its always charging the phone when connected until its dead?
thanks

The phone charges first and then the mod thereafter. No, there is no switch - the mod kicks in automatically either right away (when the phone starts discharging from 100%) or when the phone battery gets to 80% (there is a setting for this). The 80% setting is supposed to extend the life of the Moto Mod.

That's interesting. Was reading the Moto forums and people are complaining about low notifications sounds on the new Moto G phones after a recent update. It may be a Motorola thing.

As much as I hate to say it, I am afraid I am going to have to return the phone and get a Note 7 back. On looking and commenting on the Moto forum, Motorola won't even acknowledge there is a problem, so I have no confidence they will fix the issue. Most of the other things I can work around, but this is pretty much a deal breaker for me. I have missed numerous important texts because of this and can't just get past it. It is just too bad that a simple software update caused this and too bad that we can't simply roll back updates.
Tomorrow is the first day I can get a Note replacement, so won't make a final decision until tomorrow morning, but as it stands now, I will have to turn it back in.

replies.text: Have you looked into volume booster apps like osubeavs728 suggested?

thread.text: I totally understand your thought and I agree it's concerning that the issue was not addressed or acknowledged on the Moto forum, especially with it seeming to be a simple fix.

replies.text: One would think so. From what I can see, Moto is trying to blame Google, when it was working fine before Moto's update. Then you have the built in delay that Verizon puts on any update. Who knows, they may have already put a fix out there, but Verizon is doing their usual slow walk to the public. I rather think they probably have not actually coded a fix for it, though.

thread.text: I can't see how the volume boosters can override the phone firmware or OS. From what I was reading, most of them just quickly raise the volume to the maximum as defined by the phone software. I will try a couple tonight, but I also notice many are simply ad vectors.

replies.text: Please share what apps and how you feel they worked. I've considered doing the same just haven't found the time. Thank you.

title: Warm color temp when viewing straight on

thread.text:
Hello all, wanted to ask here to see if I need to swap my phone out or maybe it is normal....
I picked up a new Force with the Best Buy deal going on. I couldnt pass up a top spec phone for $524 after the gift card plus the free JBL Mod! So far I love the phone vs. my MXPE. Battery life has been great, the camera has been really great and there is zero lag with anything I do with it.
But - today I was using it and I noticed if I am looking straight on at the screen the white color temp is quite warm/yellowish tinted. Not much mind you, but it is definitely noticeable. This is with the display settings set to normal or vibrant (I prefer normal). Now if I turn the screen ever so slightly, and I mean just a couple degrees, in any direction the screen is pure white looking. If I keep going it almost gets too cool into the white/bluish range. 
My past 3 long term phones all had LCD screens and I didnt keep the S7 long enough to get used to their AMOLED screens. I didnt know if this was something normal or if I need to go exchange this. If it is normal I may try and just live with it as I think it's a killer phone for the price but it's really bugging me now that I notice it!
I don't notice that on my phone. I would take it back - especially if you're still within the return policy, and see if you can exchange it. Doesn't sound right.

Phone is 2 days old so well within return period. I am avoiding BB today with the Apple people getting their new phones! I'll stop in this weekend. They had none on display so I couldnt even try one out. 
I really like the phone so far. I get bad signal but I've still only lost 19% over 6 hours with 1 hour screen time. Way better than my MXPE. Better than my 5x with Nougat but that phone has terrible reception vs. either Moto. I also got some great shots of my kids at the park yesterday.
It really is a solid, honest phone. Not the most bells and whistles, it just works for the most part.
It might just be something with the AMOLED if you aren't used to it. Hard to say.
Better to be safe than sorry so I'd swap it out to play it safe. If your next one does it, then you'll know for sure it's just the software and normal. I've not noticed it on mine either though.
Turn off adaptive brightness and check how it looks. That makes mind very warm in tone. Tilting it makes the screen turn a blue/green color

I finally made it into a Verizon store to compare to their Force. It was white no matter what direction I tilted the screen vs. mine. Mine when head on looks like the white balance is off and too warm when taking a photo unless I slightly tilt the screen. This is with any white background, adaptive brightness on or off and the actual color temp set from "vivid" to "normal". The higher the brightness the less it is noticeable but it is still there. 
The bad news is BB is out of stock at every store around me so I cant just exchange it for a new one. I need to ask what the policy is when that happens. I'm guessing they can ship one out or something.
Oh, I also tried out the Z Play at Verizon. That phone is pretty nice for a $400 phone! Plenty snappy doing basic stuff, screen was very clear and the headphone jack was nice. Still think the Force was worth the extra $100 and free JBL mod but the Play is a nice mid-range phone.

replies.text: I'm sure you could start the exchange process at BestBuy without them having one in stock. They'll probably order one in & put your name on it.

thread.text:
I was in luck at Best Buy, they had received two more in stock earlier in the day. Took over an hour to swap it out due to a Verizon glitch and then the new phone wouldnt make a test call. Ended up swapping SIM cards out and all was well. New phone looks way better than the old one. Still has a tiny hint of yellow but after researching AMOLED screens a lot of them do. It's definitely better than the old phone so it's a keeper.
Now to find a decent screen protector... The screen is actually wavy when looking at a steep angle against reflected light. I am not surprised a lot of glass protectors have issues sticking flat.
Glad you got that worked out. My husband loves his Z Force.
Has anyone noticed that automatic brightness is not working? I have double checked the settings and no matter what the ambient light level of the room, the brightness does not change at all.

replies.text: Make sure you don't have battery saving mode enabled, or any other setting which would conflict with automatic brightness. Also, I would suggest cleaning the screen/sensor area to make sure there's nothing obstructing the sensor from detecting the lighting of the room.

thread.text:
Ok. I think I figured it out, but it is not intuitive. In fact, it seems a backwards way to do it. Apparently the brightness slider is the base of the brightness, the lowest brightness will go. The adaptive brightness works from there.
I set the slider to a low amount, went into a dim room and after a few seconds, the screen darkened to that base, but it was not smooth and took a bit too long. When I shone a flashlight at the sensor, it brightened back up.
So when I had the slider all the way up, it looked like the adaptive brightness was not working because it could not go below the max brightness.
Strange way of doing it, but at least I understand it now.
